books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A story set in a totalitarian society ruled by Big Brother.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A classic novel about the manners and matrimonial machinations of early 19th-century English society.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A story about a teenager's struggle with growing up and society.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A novel about the decline of the American Dream in the 1920s.

books.title: Moby Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: A whaling voyage that explores themes of fate, revenge, and the unknown.

books.title: War and Peace
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A novel that intertwines the lives of individuals during the Napoleonic wars.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.description: The journey of Odysseus after the fall of Troy and his quest to return home.

books.title: Jane Eyre
books.author: Charlotte Brontë
books.description: A story of an orphaned girl’s struggle for independence and love.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A vision of a future society where technology and pleasure control humanity.

books.title: The Brothers Karamazov
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: A tale about family, faith, and free will.

books.title: Wuthering Heights
books.author: Emily Brontë
books.description: A tragic story of love, revenge, and fate on the Yorkshire moors.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: An epic tale of the battle between good and evil in Middle-earth.

books.title: The Divine Comedy
books.author: Dante Alighieri
books.description: A journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

books.title: The Grapes of Wrath
books.author: John Steinbeck
books.description: A family’s struggle to survive during the Great Depression.

books.title: Anna Karenina
books.author: Leo Tolstoy
books.description: A tragic tale of love, betrayal, and society in Russia.

books.title: Crime and Punishment
books.author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
books.description: The moral dilemmas of a young man after he commits a murder.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: Bilbo Baggins' adventure to win a share of the treasure guarded by Smaug the dragon.

books.title: Frankenstein
books.author: Mary Shelley
books.description: A scientist's creation of life and the monster it becomes.

books.title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.description: A man who never ages while his portrait shows the marks of sin and time.

books.title: Dracula
books.author: Bram Stoker
books.description: A vampire’s attempt to move from Transylvania to England.

books.title: Les Misérables
books.author: Victor Hugo
books.description: The struggles of ex-convict Jean Valjean and his quest for redemption.

books.title: The Count of Monte Cristo
books.author: Alexandre Dumas
books.description: A man’s quest for revenge against those who wronged him.

books.title: Don Quixote
books.author: Miguel de Cervantes
books.description: A man’s quest to revive chivalry by becoming a knight-errant.

books.title: Fahrenheit 451
books.author: Ray Bradbury
books.description: A future where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn them.

books.title: The Iliad
books.author: Homer
books.description: The story of the Trojan War and the Greek hero Achilles.

books.title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
books.author: Mark Twain
books.description: A young boy’s journey down the Mississippi River with a runaway slave.

books.title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
books.author: Gabriel García Márquez
books.description: The rise and fall of the Buendía family over generations.

books.title: The Stranger
books.author: Albert Camus
books.description: An absurdist novel about a man’s indifference to society and morality.

books.title: A Tale of Two Cities
books.author: Charles Dickens
books.description: A story of love and sacrifice set during the French Revolution.
